item.title: 市场狂飙后的平静并不令人安心
item.description:
贸易商仍处于紧张状态，等待贸易战的进一步发展 

Traders still on edge, awaiting further developments in trade war 

】

item.title: 日本关税小组期待美国谈判早日取得成果
item.description: 日本最高贸易代表赤泽亮世表示，日本将争取在一天左右开始的美国关税谈判中尽早取得成果。【原文：Japan will seek early results from its US tariff negotiations set to start in a day or so, according to top trade representative Ryosei Akazawa.】

item.title: 竞争加剧，肯尼亚寻求私人资金建设港口
item.description: 肯尼亚计划寻求私人投资来开发和运营印度洋上的两个海港，以应对邻国港口日益激烈的竞争。【原文：Kenya plans to seek private investment to develop and operate two seaports on the Indian Ocean as it battles rising competition from harbors in neighboring countries.】

item.title: 加纳与国际货币基金组织就支付 3.7 亿美元达成员工级别协议
item.description: 在美国关税颠覆全球贸易和市场之际，加纳将从国际货币基金组织获得 3.7 亿美元的分期付款。【原文：Ghana is set to receive a $370 million instalment from the International Monetary Fund as US tariffs upend global trade and markets.】

item.title: 零日期权显示 VIX 如何低估关税引发的动荡
item.description: 在股票交易者等待唐纳德-特朗普总统的下一轮关税头条之际，期权市场的一角显示出波动性可以达到多么极端的程度。【原文：As equity traders await the next barrage of tariff headlines from President Donald Trump, one corner of the options markets showed just how extreme the volatility can get.】

item.title: 花旗认为印度债券在全球大跌中仍有反弹空间
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）的当地市场主管表示，印度的债券涨势无视了美国关税引发的全球债市崩盘，但仍有延伸的空间。【原文：India’s bond rally, which has defied a global debt market meltdown amid US tariffs, has room to extend, according to Citigroup Inc.’s local markets chief.】

item.title: 英国招聘人员指责特朗普关税导致 2025 年缺乏知名度
item.description: 华德士集团（Robert Walters Plc）首席执行官托比-福尔斯顿（Toby Fowlston）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在关税问题上的反常举动使严峻的招聘环境雪上加霜。【原文：Robert Walters Plc Chief Executive Officer Toby Fowlston said US President Donald Trump’s tariff antics have made a tough hiring environment worse.】

item.title: 美国银行民调显示，投资者 30 年来从未如此看跌
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的一项调查显示，投资者对经济前景的看法是三十年来最消极的，但基金经理们的悲观情绪并没有完全反映在他们的资产配置中，这可能意味着美股会遭受更多损失。【原文：Investor sentiment regarding economic prospects is the most negative in three decades, yet fund managers’ pessimism isn’t fully reflected in their asset allocation which could mean more losses for US stocks, a Bank of America Corp. survey shows.】

item.title: 美国贸易混乱导致德国投资者前景黯淡
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普断断续续的贸易措施有可能扼杀德国经济的复苏势头，投资者对德国经济的信心急剧下降。【原文：Investor confidence in Germany’s economy plummeted as US President Donald Trump’s on-off trade measures threaten to choke off a nascent recovery.】

item.title: 野村据说将把东京大厦出售给房地产关联公司
item.description: 据知情人士透露，野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. sold a training center in central Tokyo to its real estate affiliate, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 马阿拉歌会员资格如何解释特朗普的关税迷恋
item.description:
在总统眼中，关税可能只是其他国家进入优质市场所应付出的代价。【原文：

In the president’s eyes, tariffs might simply be the price other countries should pay for admission to a premium market.

】

item.title: 特朗普关税战激怒市场，印度贸易逆差扩大
item.description: 印度的贸易赤字在 3 月份有所扩大，尽管这个南亚国家的政策制定者和出口商都在努力抵御美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全球关税战。【原文：India’s trade deficit widened in March, even as policymakers and exporters in the South Asian nation scramble to shield themselves from US President Donald Trump’s global tariff war.】

item.title: JD Vance 认为英美贸易协定具有 "巨大 "潜力
item.description: 美国副总统万斯（JD Vance）表示，唐纳德-特朗普政府很有可能与英国达成一项对两国都有利的经济协议，从而推动英国政府削减贸易壁垒的努力。【原文：US Vice President JD Vance said it’s likely Donald Trump’s administration will seal an economic agreement with the UK that benefits both nations, in a boost to the British government’s efforts to cut trade barriers.】

item.title: 前官员称，如果美国不尊重中国，中国就不会谈判
item.description: 一位中国前高级经济官员表示，只有美国领导人对北京表示尊重，中国才会与美国进行会谈。【原文：China will only engage in talks with the US if its leaders show respect toward Beijing, according to a former top Chinese economic official.】

item.title: 加密货币公司 Bitdeer 优先挖矿以抵御关税动荡
item.description: 在纳斯达克上市的比特币挖矿公司比特大陆科技集团（Bitdeer Technologies Group）正在加倍努力开展自挖业务，同时推进在美国制造机器的计划，因为该公司正面临着加密货币市场的降温和美国贸易政策日益加剧的不确定性。【原文：Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining firm Bitdeer Technologies Group is doubling down on its self-mining operations while pushing ahead with plans to make machines in the US, as it confronts a cooling crypto market and mounting uncertainty over US trade policy.】

item.title: 中国称美国黑客攻击 2025 年亚冬会网络
item.description: 中国指控美国间谍机构入侵了今年在哈尔滨举行的亚洲冬季运动会，并采取了不同寻常的步骤，指认其认为应对此负责的个人。【原文：China accused a US spy agency of hacking the Asian Winter Games held this year in Harbin, and took the unusual step of identifying individuals it thinks are responsible.】

item.title: 皮博迪拒绝为 21 亿美元贷款进行私人债务再融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，煤炭开采公司皮博迪能源公司（Peabody Energy Corp.【原文：Coal mining company Peabody Energy Corp. has held off seeking a $500 million private debt, which would help refinance an acquisition loan after the planned deal was put under review, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 奇货可居：哈维尔-布拉斯谈中国的稀土主导地位（播客）

In this episode, recorded in Bloomberg’s London studio, Bloomberg Opinion columnist Javier Blas helps us clear up some misconceptions about them. For one thing, rare earths aren’t actually that rare. Furthermore, the amount of global trade of these minerals is fairly minuscule. The US only im】

item.title: 国际能源署称，随着需求下降，2026 年全球石油过剩将持续存在
item.description: 在贸易战酝酿之际，国际能源机构下调了今年的全球石油需求预测，并在其首次对 2026 年的详细评估中预测供应将持续过剩。【原文：The International Energy Agency slashed forecasts for global oil demand this year amid the brewing trade war, and in its first detailed assessment of 2026 predicted a persistent supply surplus.】

item.title: 政治与天价收益率相抗衡，Pimco 减少对土耳其的押注
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：Pacific Investment Management Co. trimmed its holdings of Turkish bonds last month amid the selloff sparked by the arrest of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s top political opponent.】

item.title: 英国批准对电网排队进行全面改革，努力净化电力系统
item.description: 英国能源监管机构 Ofgem 批准对电网连接管理方式进行全面改革，这是加快清洁电力项目的关键一步。【原文：UK energy regulator Ofgem approved an overhaul of the way grid linkups are managed, a crucial step to accelerating clean-power projects.】

item.title: 混乱的股市和大选对你的超级帐户意味着什么？
item.description:
在本周的澳大利亚播客中：克里斯-伯克（Chris Bourke）与澳大利亚养老基金协会（Association of Superannuation Funds Australia）首席执行官就迫在眉睫的大选和市场混乱时期的养老基金管理进行了对话

。【原文：

On this week’s Australia Podcast: Chris Bourke talks to the CEO of the Association of Superannuation Funds Australia about the looming election and managing pension funds in a time of market chaos

】

item.title: 日本命令谷歌停止强迫手机制造商使用其应用程序
item.description: 就在本周与美国进行高风险贸易谈判之前，日本公平贸易委员会命令 Alphabet Inc.【原文：Japan’s Fair Trade Commission ordered Alphabet Inc.’s Google to stop alleged abuse of its market power over local smartphone manufacturers, just ahead of high-stakes trade negotiations with the US this week.】

item.title: 瑞典公布春季预算刺激低迷经济
item.description: 瑞典宣布了旨在刺激疲软经济的支出计划，因为全球贸易战给这个北欧最大国家的前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Sweden announced spending plans aimed at stimulating the sluggish economy as a global trade war muddies the outlook for the biggest Nordic country.】

item.title: 沙特咖啡连锁店寻找银行家寻求上市机会
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯咖啡连锁店 Barn's 已开始在利雅得进行首次公开募股，以扩大其在中东的业务范围。【原文：Saudi Arabian coffee chain Barn’s has started work on an initial public offering in Riyadh as it seeks to expand its footprint in the Middle East.】

item.title: 香港机场成功发行债券后寻求 26 亿美元贷款
item.description: 香港机场管理局正在寻求约 200 亿港元（26 亿美元）的银团贷款。【原文：The Airport Authority Hong Kong is seeking a syndicated loan of about HK$20 billion ($2.6 billion), people familiar with the matter said, months after completing one of the largest bond offerings by a local issuer.】

item.title: 阿布扎比通过先进的癌症治疗设施深化医疗卫生事业
item.description: 阿布扎比将在中东地区建立一个先进的癌症治疗中心，这标志着阿布扎比在数十亿美元的多元化发展计划中向医疗保健领域的最新进军。【原文：Abu Dhabi is set to build an advanced cancer treatment center in the Middle East, marking its latest foray into the health-care sector as part of a multibillion-dollar diversification push.】

item.title: 四月增税前英国就业人数创大流行病以来最大降幅
item.description: 英国企业在受到 260 亿英镑（约合 343 亿美元）工资税增加和美国关税打击前不久，以自大流行病开始以来最快的速度裁员。【原文：UK businesses shed workers at the fastest pace since the start of the pandemic shortly before they were hit by a £26 billion ($34.3 billion) rise in payroll taxes and US tariffs.】

item.title: 印度股市收复特朗普 4 月 2 日关税引发的跌幅
item.description: 印度股市在长周末后恢复交易时反弹，基准股票指数抹去了本月早些时候美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收对等关税引发的所有损失。【原文：Indian stocks rallied as trading resumed after a long weekend, with the benchmark equity index erasing all the losses triggered by US President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs earlier this month.】
